entry.title: https://github.com/NVIDIA/cub
entry.content: [ARCHIVED] Cooperative primitives for CUDA C++. See https://github.com/NVIDIA/cccl

entry.title: https://github.com/mit-han-lab/torchsparse
entry.content: [MICRO'23, MLSys'22] TorchSparse: Efficient Training and Inference Framework for Sparse Convolution on GPUs.

entry.title: https://github.com/Liu-xiandong/How_to_optimize_in_GPU
entry.content: This is a series of GPU optimization topics. Here we will introduce how to optimize the CUDA kernel in detail. I will introduce several basic kernel optimizations, including: elementwise, reduce, sgemv, sgemm, etc. The performance of these kernels is basically at or near the theoretical limit.

entry.title: https://github.com/rapidsai/raft
entry.content: RAFT contains fundamental widely-used algorithms and primitives for machine learning and information retrieval. The algorithms are CUDA-accelerated and form building blocks for more easily writing high performance applications.

entry.title: https://github.com/rapidsai/cuvs
entry.content: cuVS - a library for vector search and clustering on the GPU

entry.content: A massively parallel, optimal functional runtime in Rust

entry.content: Causal depthwise conv1d in CUDA, with a PyTorch interface

entry.title: https://github.com/NVlabs/instant-ngp
entry.content: Instant neural graphics primitives: lightning fast NeRF and more

entry.title: https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer
entry.content: FlashInfer: Kernel Library for LLM Serving

entry.title: https://github.com/thu-ml/SageAttention
entry.content: Quantized Attention that achieves speedups of 2.1-3.1x and 2.7-5.1x compared to FlashAttention2 and xformers, respectively, without lossing end-to-end metrics across various models.
